newsitem.title: JAPAN: Arabian Oil confident of drilling rights renewal.
newsitem.headline: Arabian Oil confident of drilling rights renewal.

text.p: Arabian Oil Co Ltd said on Tuesday it was confident its talks with Saudi Arabia and Kuwait would result in the renewal of its right to drill in oil fields near the Saudi-Kuwaiti border.
"I believe the talks are heading in the right direction," Arabian Oil president Keiichi Konaga told reporters.
Arabian Oil, whose concessions with Saudi Arabia and Kuwait expire in 2000 and 2003 respectively has been negotiating with the two countries for extensions.
Arabian Oil produces about 280,000 barrels per day of crude oil from the oil fields.
